alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 8:13AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT/1015 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Franklin. In Panhandle Florida, Gulf. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT /1015 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 812 AM EDT /712 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas could cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 2 Hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port St. Joe, Apalachicola, Odena, Eleven Mile, Nine Mile, Thirteen Mile, Tilton, White City, Ward Ridge, Jones Homestead, Bay City, Apalachicola Airport, Howard Creek, Indian Pass, Milltown, Simmons Bayou, Highland View, Willis Landing and Dalkeith. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
